Message.Title: ( NEOM ) NEOMEDIA TECHNOLOGIES IS READY TO SURGE ...U COULD MAKE 1000% OR MORE
Message.Msg: BOULDER – NeoMedia Technologies Inc. (OCT BB: NEOM) has granted Microsoft a worldwide, non-exclusive license to NeoMedia’s patent portfolio, the Boulder-based company announced. NeoMedia’s IP portfolio, consisting of more than 74 patents awarded and pending worldwide, includes many mobile barcode implementations used widely across the industry. NeoMedia is a pioneer in 2D mobile barcode technology and infrastructure that enables the mobile barcode ecosystem worldwide, the company said. The technology can transform a mobile device with a camera into a barcode scanner, enabling a range of applications including mobile marketing, consumer-oriented advertising and mobile ticketing and couponing. “The agreement between NeoMedia and Microsoft underscores the importance of intellectual property to our growing industry,” said Laura Marriott, NeoMedia’s CEO. “As mobile barcodes become a key fixture in the mobile marketing mix, it is important for stakeholders across the industry to ensure the solutions they employ leverage the relevant intellectual property in a responsible manner.” NeoMedia’s current customers include handset manufacturers, platform providers, brands and agencies.

Message.Title: Bank of America Corporation (BAC) Ex-Dividend Date Scheduled for February 27, 2013
Message.Msg: Bank of America Corporation ( BAC ) will begin trading ex-dividend on February 27, 2013. A cash dividend payment of $0.01 per share is scheduled to be paid on March 22, 2013. Shareholders who purchased BAC stock prior to the ex-dividend date are eligible for the cash dividend payment. This marks the 16th quarter that BAC has paid the same dividend. The previous trading day's last sale of BAC was $11.44, representing a -7.89% decrease from the 52 week high of $12.42 and a 70.24% increase over the 52 week low of $6.72. BAC is a part of the Finance sector, which includes companies such as Wells Fargo & Company ( WFC ) and J P Morgan Chase & Co ( JPM ). BAC's current earnings per share, an indicator of a company's profitability, is $.25. Zacks Investment Research reports BAC's forecasted earnings growth in 2013 as 305.23%, compared to an industry average of 2.9%.

Message.Msg: I can see we are droping again from the pre-market gain. Absolutely dissapointing. All markets have recovered from the shocking Wednesday news expect Bank of America. Buy before the massive increment, this is a buying oppurtunity. Again, the divident annoucement 0.01 is not a bad news, this mean the share price still have a massive upside from this point, therefore the bank doesnt need to offer an attractive divident to attract investors. therefore, my opinion is ''strong buy''

Topic.Title: day 5 of lower lows and lower highers

Message.Msg: The same thing happened at this time last year with the banks in the days leading up to the stress test. BAC popped approx. 20% on the stress test results and most of the other big banks popped as well. While I don't necessarily believe that BAC will move 20% to the upside this time, an 8-12% increase is very possible this year. Look for BAC to trade in the $11.80-$12.10 range before the results are released on March 7. $12.75-$13.50 after CCAR is released.

Topic.Title: I WISH BAC WOULD JUST GET TO WHERE IT'S GOING QUICKLY. NOW! 5$ IF NEED BE.

Message.Msg: Let me put this another way because you are probably either young and naive or old and spend maybe one hundredth of your savings on the stock market. For starters I have been doing this for 25 years. With desired results year in and year out. In 2008 while everyone was suffering, I was capitalizing. Since august 2011, however, I see a volatility in historically sound companies that I never imagined possible. BAC, AA, V, MC, even Berkshire Hathaway class A, B, Ford, GE. So watching the bs rises and bs drops for the sake of manipulators so they can be the first to correct the last 5 years erring in the undesired direction is hell bent on torture. Listening to analysts be less than analysts with their repeated failed price targets such as CNBC's Najarian calling for a price target of $12 for ZYNGA when it was 6$ and in a matter of months collapsed to $2. How does he get away with that? Cramer the day before BAC recently reported calling for a strong buy. Did he mean to say buy BAC now at $12.20 and do not mind if it goes down to $11.03 before bouncing back to 12.40 and now again 11.15? Or did he mean hold until it drops to that level and below before buying it? Maybe he just doesn't #$%$ know either? Do you think he would be happy buying BAC at 12.40 and see it drop to 11$? NO!! So don't be a naive youth and suggest the stock market isn't for me. I have made my comfortable money just as Cramer has and just as many millionaires weren't too happy to see their finances drop drastically in 2008 I am not too happy seeing mine falter instead of stabalizing so I can concentrate on other things in my life. But I will not do it until I am blasted convinced BAC is not heading back to 5$ again. Until then if you have something more worthwhile to add do so otherwise watch out because what goes around comes around and suggesting from so little that the stock market isn't for me might just be what you need to endure in order to humble yourself.
